cards.emptyState: Configure parameters and click Analyze to get recommendations.

detail.title: Detail View
detail.selectHint: Select a recommendation to view details.
detail.noData: No chart data available for this range.

llm.title: LLM Recommendation
llm.promptHint: Copy the prompt and paste it into ChatGPT or another app.
llm.apiHint: API key is stored only in this browser.
llm.empty: Run analysis and select a recommendation to enable LLM.
llm.missingConfig: Please enter API key and model.

tooltips.pair: Select a liquidity pool to analyze. Pools are ranked by on-chain metrics.
tooltips.poolLimit: Maximum number of pools to display in the dropdown list.
tooltips.poolSort: Metric used to rank and filter the pool list.
tooltips.klineSourceTip: Source of historical OHLCV kline data: Birdeye or Binance.
tooltips.window: Number of historical days of price data used for backtesting. Longer windows capture more market regimes but may dilute recent trends.
tooltips.profile: Risk profile controls how candidate ranges are scored. Different profiles weight metrics differently.
tooltips.profileConservative: Prioritizes in-range time (40%) and low IL (30%). Best for passive LPs who rebalance infrequently.
tooltips.profileBalanced: Balances in-range time, LP return, IL risk, and touch frequency evenly. Good all-around choice.
tooltips.profileAggressive: Maximizes LP vs HODL return (40%) and capital efficiency (25%). Higher risk, higher potential reward.
tooltips.strategies: Select which range-generation algorithms to include. Each produces different candidate ranges.
tooltips.strategyQuantile: Generates ranges based on historical price percentiles. Robust across different market conditions.
tooltips.strategyVolband: Uses volatility bands (mean ± N×σ) to define ranges. Adapts to current market volatility.
tooltips.strategySwing: Uses recent swing highs/lows to define support and resistance boundaries.
tooltips.capital: Amount of capital (in USD) to simulate for the LP position. Used for backtest value calculations.
tooltips.topRecommendations: Top 3 ranges ranked by composite score under your selected risk profile.
tooltips.extremeRanges: Fixed-width ranges (2% and 5%) for comparison. These are narrow and require active management.
tooltips.score: Composite score (0–100) based on weighted backtest metrics. Higher is better for your selected profile.
tooltips.scoreExplain: Score = weighted sum of normalized metrics. Weights depend on risk profile. See each profile tooltip for weight breakdown.
tooltips.range: Price range of the LP position: lower bound (Pa) to upper bound (Pb).
tooltips.ticks: Tick indices corresponding to the price range boundaries. Used by on-chain CLMM contracts.
tooltips.strategy: Algorithm that generated this candidate range.
tooltips.requestedWidth: The target width percentage requested by the strategy algorithm.
tooltips.realizedWidth: Actual width after aligning to the pool's tick spacing. May differ slightly from requested.
tooltips.expectedTouch: Average time between the price exiting the range, based on historical simulation.
tooltips.metricInRange: Percentage of backtest time the price stayed within this range. Higher means more fee-earning time.
tooltips.metricTouches: Number of times the price exited the range during the backtest. Fewer is better for passive LPs.
tooltips.metricMeanExit: Average duration of each out-of-range excursion. Shorter means the price returns quickly.
tooltips.metricLpVsHodl: Relative return of LP position vs simply holding the tokens. Positive means LP outperformed.
tooltips.metricMaxIl: Maximum impermanent loss observed during the backtest. Lower is safer.
tooltips.metricMaxDd: Maximum peak-to-trough drawdown of the LP position value. Lower is safer.
tooltips.metricCapEff: Capital efficiency multiplier compared to a full-range position. Higher means more concentrated liquidity.
tooltips.highTouch: Price exits this range frequently -- you may need to rebalance often.
tooltips.ultraNarrow: Extremely narrow range with very high capital efficiency but high IL risk.
tooltips.activeMgmt: This range requires active monitoring and frequent rebalancing to remain profitable.
tooltips.chartLpVsHodl: Compares the simulated LP position value against a simple HODL strategy over time.
tooltips.chartIl: Shows the impermanent loss percentage over time. Larger negative values mean more IL.
tooltips.chartPrice: Historical price chart with the LP range boundaries overlaid. Shaded areas show in-range periods.
tooltips.insightTight: Tight range ({width}% width) with {inRange}% in-range time — high capital efficiency but watch for IL.
tooltips.insightModerate: Moderate range ({width}% width) capturing {inRange}% of price action.
tooltips.insightWide: Wide range ({width}% width) captures {inRange}% of price action — lower IL risk at cost of efficiency.
tooltips.insightIlWarning: Max IL reached {pct}% — consider tighter rebalance.
tooltips.detailWidthTight: very concentrated, maximizes fee capture per dollar but requires close monitoring
tooltips.detailWidthModerate: a balanced width that captures most price action while maintaining good efficiency
tooltips.detailWidthWide: wide and defensive, reduces rebalancing frequency at the cost of capital efficiency
tooltips.detailInRange: Price stayed in range {pct}% of the backtest period — {inRangeVerdict}
tooltips.detailInRangeHigh: excellent coverage, your position earns fees almost continuously
tooltips.detailInRangeMed: decent coverage, but expect some periods with no fee income
tooltips.detailInRangeLow: significant time out of range, fees earned may not offset IL risk
tooltips.detailTouchesMed: moderate exits, plan for occasional rebalancing
tooltips.detailTouchesHigh: frequent exits, requires active management or automation
tooltips.detailMeanExitSlow: extended out-of-range periods, consider wider range or auto-rebalance
tooltips.detailLpBetter: LP strategy adds value over simply holding
tooltips.detailLpSimilar: roughly break-even with HODL, fee income offsets IL
tooltips.detailLpWorse: HODL outperforms, IL drag exceeds fee income
tooltips.detailIlLow: minimal IL, safe for passive positions
tooltips.detailIlMed: moderate IL, acceptable for most strategies
tooltips.detailIlHigh: significant IL risk, consider tighter rebalancing or wider range
tooltips.detailCapEffHigh: highly concentrated liquidity, maximizing fee yield per dollar
tooltips.detailCapEffMed: good efficiency, solid fee capture without excessive risk
tooltips.detailCapEffLow: low concentration, similar to a full-range position
